docs.abstract: Health | You'd think the proliferation of Wal-Marts, many packed with cheap processed foods, would promote obesity. In fact, a big-box retailer's presence in an area seems to decrease weight slightly, a study found. "The researchers think this happens because cheaper goods from Wal-Mart allow shoppers to spend more of their budget on relatively expensive healthier foods." [Odd Numbers]
docs.lead_paragraph: Health | You'd think the proliferation of Wal-Marts, many packed with cheap processed foods, would promote obesity. In fact, a big-box retailer's presence in an area seems to decrease weight slightly, a study found. "The researchers think this happens because cheaper goods from Wal-Mart allow shoppers to spend more of their budget on relatively expensive healthier foods." [Odd Numbers, Social Science Research Network]

docs.abstract: Gov. David A. Paterson gave his first State of the State address, marking a turning point in the changeover of state government.
docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 4:22 p.m. | Gov. David A. Paterson, who become New York's chief executive on March 17 after his predecessor resigned in disgrace, on Wednesday delivered his first State of the State address, comparing the state's mounting fiscal crisis to other challenges that have confronted the state since the Revolution.
docs.snippet: Gov. David A. Paterson gave his first State of the State address, marking a turning point in the changeover of state government.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers said that especially with young patients who were overweight but not yet obese, doctors might be missing a good chance to intervene.

docs.abstract: In this lesson, students reflect on the entrepreneurship and innovative spirit of their generation. Then, they propose innovative ideas related to topics and issues they are studying in the classroom.
docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
